meanings.definition: A large drinking bowl or goblet, typically made of wood.
meanings.sent1: The mazer was passed around the table during the feast.
meanings.sent2: He drank from the mazer, feeling the smooth wood against his lips.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked the mazer off the table, spilling its contents.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the hall as she raised the mazer in a toast.
meanings.sent5: The intricate carvings on the mazer depicted scenes of ancient battles.

meanings.sent1: Lost in the forest, he began to mazer in circles, unsure of which way to go.
meanings.sent2: She liked to mazer through the city streets, discovering new shops and cafes.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to mazer through the park, enjoying the sunny day.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts seemed to mazer from one topic to another, never staying focused.
meanings.sent5: The river mazered lazily through the meadow, taking its time to reach the sea.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or tricked.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the village mazer, always falling for pranks and jokes.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been a mazer in the con artist's scheme.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tricked the mazer into giving him all the food.
meanings.sent4: The old wizard chuckled at the young mazer's gullibility.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the smooth-talking salesman; he preys on unsuspecting mazers.
